course_title: Special Topics: Korean: Rel.Beliefs&Practices in Korea
class_notes: This course introduces students to religions in Korea including shamanism, Confucianism, Buddhism, Christianity, Islam, and new religious movements and explores how these religions interacted with each other and how religious beliefs and practices have shaped Korean people's ways of thinking and behavior as well as the culture and society.
course_description: An interdisciplinary course that introduces students to Korean culture and society. No knowledge of Korean is required. Topics to be announced each semester.
sections: Class Nbr: 2636, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 10-11:15a, Instructor: Y. Kim, Status: Open
